result.execSummary:
The defendant Maria T Ocampo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-02-2015 OR 3 days Huber Consecutive to any other sentence for contempt for non-compliance with court order.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 0 days.

Defendant motioned for release pending appeal - Judge Denied.

Defendant's notice of Intent to pursue Postconviction Relief filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maria T Ocampo

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:06 pm.
Defendant Maria T Ocampo in court with attorney Ness Flores.  
Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter Patrick Ryan in court, sworn in.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed Sentence of:
5 Days Huber commencing 7/28/2015 @ 5pm.  (Credit - 0 days)  HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.

Costs: $253.00 
(To to be paid at the rate of $50  per month commencing 9/1/2015; OR 3 days Huber Consecutive to any other sentence for contempt for non-compliance with court order).
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maria T Ocampo in court with attorney Michael Reyes for attorney Ness Flores.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Atty. Reyes states his client is participating in a program to be completed in early July.  Defense requests a date after July 15. Court grants request. Patrick given date and time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maria T Ocampo in court with attorney Ness Flores.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan sworn.  
Atty. Flores states his client will finish counseling in July.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Maria T Ocampo in court with attorney Ness Flores.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will need interpreter for future court dates.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
